content.raw: I was playing with VRC1 world, atlas, car and RVIZ. I did not see any major issues.
content.html: I was playing with VRC1 world, atlas, car and RVIZ. I did not see any major issues.

content.raw: skipped tag `2`, though it shouldn't matter
content.html: skipped tag 2, though it shouldn't matter

content.raw: Tested spawning a pr2, and it appears that multiple LaserVisuals have been created for pr2's laser visualization. The laser's color also gets darker as you move the model around with the mouse, which implies that duplicate visuals are being created. This could to be related to the lag mentioned in the previous comment.
content.html: Tested spawning a pr2, and it appears that multiple LaserVisuals have been created for pr2's laser visualization. The laser's color also gets darker as you move the model around with the mouse, which implies that duplicate visuals are being created. This could to be related to the lag mentioned in the previous comment.

content.raw: I am also experiencing this behavior with more complex models like atlas and the drc vehicle. Other simple models are fine.
content.html: I am also experiencing this behavior with more complex models like atlas and the drc vehicle. Other simple models are fine.

content.raw: yep, after releasing mouse button, it takes a couple of seconds before gui responds.
content.html: yep, after releasing mouse button, it takes a couple of seconds before gui responds.

content.raw: By "GUI manipulation is slow", do you mean the time it takes to show the new position of a moved object after the mouse button is released is long?
content.html: By "GUI manipulation is slow", do you mean the time it takes to show the new position of a moved object after the mouse button is released is long?

content.raw: so far so good.  I ran it on vrc worlds 1~3 and did some manual teleoperation without running into issues.  Gui manipulation is slow, but that should not be a concern here.  [jenkins](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-precise-amd64/82/) reports factory test failure, but the test passes on my desktop.
content.html: so far so good. I ran it on vrc worlds 1~3 and did some manual teleoperation without running into issues. Gui manipulation is slow, but that should not be a concern here. jenkins reports factory test failure, but the test passes on my desktop.

content.raw: Looks like it passed all the tests on the drcsim_2.6-gazebo-any build.
content.html: Looks like it passed all the tests on the drcsim_2.6-gazebo-any build.

content.raw: I created a [drcsim_2.6-gazebo-any job](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/drcsim-drcsim_2.6-gazebo-any-devel-precise-amd64-gpu-sl-vrc/) and launched a new [run for this branch](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/drcsim-drcsim_2.6-gazebo-any-devel-precise-amd64-gpu-sl-vrc/2/) to see what happen with drcsim tests based on a gazebo specific branch.
content.html: I created a drcsim_2.6-gazebo-any job and launched a new run for this branch to see what happen with drcsim tests based on a gazebo specific branch.

content.raw: I took the liberty of merging with gazebo_1.8 and starting a bunch of gazebo-any jobs on jenkins with this branch.
content.html: I took the liberty of merging with gazebo_1.8 and starting a bunch of gazebo-any jobs on jenkins with this branch.
